The [[interactive television]] [[game show]] ''[[Hugo (franchise)|Hugo]]'' sparked numerous [[video game]]s based on or inspired by the show. The series of more than 30 games, including [[Spin-off (media)|spin-offs]], sold over 10 million copies{{Cite web | url=http://www.km-animation.dk/studioProfile.php | title=Studio Profile | work=Krogh Mortensen Animation}} for the [[Amiga]], [[Commodore 64]], [[Personal computer|PC]], [[PlayStation (console)|PlayStation]], [[PlayStation 2]], [[Game Boy]], and [[mobile game]] systems. Most of the titles are [[platform game]]s or [[minigame]] sets, but there are also some [[quiz]]-type [[educational game]]s. There were also various editions and [[Product bundling|compilations]] of the titles. In 2005, '''''Hugo''''' was rebranded as '''''Agent Hugo''''' for a new series of games. ==''Hugo'' series== {{Main|Hugo (video game)}} ==''Agent Hugo'' series== ''Agent Hugo'' is a series of [[action game]]s by ITE Media based on the [[Hugo (franchise)|Hugo]] franchise. The original game was released in [[2005 in video gaming|2005]], only in [[Europe]]. It was followed by ''Agent Hugo: Roborumble'' in [[2006 in video gaming|2006]], ''Agent Hugo - Lemoon Twist'' in [[2007 in video gaming|2007]], and ''Agent Hugo: Hula Holiday'' in [[2008 in video gaming|2008]]. {{Video game titles| {{Video game titles/item |article= |title= Agent Hugo |date= {{vgrelease|EU=October 2005}} |refs= {{Cite web | url=http://www.gamefaqs.com/computer/doswin/data/930809.html | title=Agent Hugo Release Information for PC | work=[[GameFAQs]] | accessdate=2009-06-12}} |release= 2005 â [[Mobile phone|Mobile]], [[PlayStation 2]], [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]]{{Cite web | url=http://www.gamefaqs.com/portable/mobile/data/930812.html | title=Agent Hugo Release Information for Mobile | work=GameFAQs | accessdate=2009-06-12}}{{Cite web | url=http://www.gamefaqs.com/console/ps2/data/930810.html | title=Agent Hugo Release Information for PlayStation 2 | work=GameFAQs | accessdate=2009-06-12}} |multiplereleasedates= no |notes= *Developed and published by ITE Media. *It was planned to also be released on the [[GameCube]], but was canceled.{{Cite web | url=http://au.gamespot.com/gamecube/action/agenthugo/index.html | title=Agent Hugo for GameCube | work=[[GameSpot]] | accessdate=2009-06-12}} }} {{-}} {{Video game titles/item |article= |title= Agent Hugo: Roborumble |date= {{vgrelease|EU=October 6, 2006}} {{vgrelease|EU=April 2, 2007}} |refs= {{Cite web | url=http://www.gamefaqs.com/console/ps2/data/936014.html | title=Agent Hugo: Roborumble Release Information for PlayStation 2 | work=GameFAQs | accessdate=2009-06-12}} |release= 2006 â [[PlayStation 2]]

2008 â [[Wii]]{{Cite web | url=http://www.gamefaqs.com/console/wii/data/958038.html | title=Agent Hugo: Lemoon Twist Release Information for Wii | work=GameFAQs | accessdate=2009-06-12}} |multiplereleasedates= yes |notes= *Developed by Coyote Console and published by ITE Media. }} {{-}} {{Video game titles/item |article= |title= Agent Hugo: Hula Holiday |date= {{vgrelease|EU=December 6, 2008}} |refs= {{Cite web | url=http://www.gamefaqs.com/console/wii/data/958037.html | title=Agent Hugo: Hula Holiday Release Information for Wii | work=GameFAQs | accessdate=2009-06-12}} |release= 2008 â [[PlayStation 2]], [[Wii]], [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]]{{Cite web | url=http://www.gamefaqs.com/console/ps2/data/958397.html | title=Agent Hugo: Hula Holiday Release Information for PlayStation 2 | work=GameFAQs | accessdate=2009-06-12}} |multiplereleasedates= no |notes= *Developed and published by NDS Software. }} }} ==Other games== ===''Hugo and the Kikurean Sunstones''=== ''Hugo and the Kikurean Sunstones'' is a [[3D computer graphics|3D]] platform game in the style of ''[[Crash Bandicoot]]'' that was developed and published by ITE Media on November 3, 2000, for the [[PlayStation (console)|PlayStation]]. In this game, the deep-jungle village of the otherwise cheerful Kikurians is in great danger. The volcano near the village can erupt at any moment, since the evil witch Scylla clogged the crater with a huge boulder, threatening to flood the Kikurian village with lava. To save the village, Hugo must find three magic sun stones located in three places: in an old [[Inca]] pyramid, in old mine and in Scylla's dungeons. ===''Hugo: Black Diamond Fever''=== ''Hugo: Black Diamond Fever'' is a 3D platform game that was developed and published by ITE Media on August 23, 2005, for the PlayStation. A [[Mobile game|mobile]] version was developed and published by Kiloo ApS in 2004. For this game, Scylla is back and this time she found the spell that would make her the most powerful witch of all time. For this, she requires very rare black diamonds, which are to be found on the jungle island where the Kikurians live. She takes them all prisoner and forces them to work day and night in search of black diamonds. The Kikurian elder asks Hugo to liberate the slaves and stop Scylla's evil plot before it is too late. ===''Hugo: Bukkazoom!''=== ''Hugo: Bukkazoom!'' was developed by ITE Media and published by [[Namco]] on October 31, 2003, for the [[Game Boy Advance]]. ===''Hugo: Cannon Cruise''=== ''Hugo: Cannon Cruise'' was developed and published by ITE Media on November 3, 2004, for the [[PlayStation 2]] and [[Personal computer|PC]]. In this game, Scylla has discovered the location of the Phoenix Tree, in which only once every 1,000 years a single apple grows. If one eats the apple after it has become ripe, his or her three wishes will be fulfilled. Scylla strives from the deepest soul for absolute power and eternal beauty â and because she hates the trolls, she would love to see them eradicated. Now she sees her chance for all of her wishes to come true. Hugo and his friend Fernando must reach the cave before the witch does, or else he and all the trolls will be destroyed. ===''Hugo: Jungle Island''=== ''Hugo: Jungle Island'' is a series of two 3D platform games, originally released by ITE Media in 1999 and 2000 for the PC. In these games, Scylla has once again kidnapped Hugo's family, but this time she keeps them prisoner on a jungle island. ===''Hugo: Smakkaball''=== Together with his family, his friends, and even his sworn enemies, Hugo takes part in a Smakkaball sport tournament. ===''Hugo: The Evil Mirror''=== ''Hugo: The Evil Mirror'' was developed by ITE Media and published by Namco for the PC, PlayStation, GameBoy Advance, and [[GameBoy Color]]. It was released in Europe on May 2, 2002; and in North America on April 24, 2005. In this game, Scylla has used her magic powers to trap Hugo in a mirror. The wicked witch broke it into three pieces and magically scattered the pieces across the world.Then Scylla kidnappes Hugolina to steal her beauty. Hugo's three children, Rit, Rat, and Ruth, are the only ones who can free him. To break the spell, each child must find a piece of the mirror.The kids put the mirror together and Hugo is able to defeat Mirror Scylla and break the spell. After the fight Hugo gets out of the mirror and traps Scylaa on it and breaks it into pieces and saves Hugolina. ===''Hugo: The Forces of Nature''=== ''Hugo: The Forces of Nature'' is an [[educational game]] published by ITE Media on October 4, 2002, for the PC. In this game, natural disasters have struck the island where the Kikurians live. It is up to Hugo to stand up against the forces of nature and, in the end, battle Scylla as well. ===''Hugo: Wintergames''=== ''Hugo: Wintergames'' is a series of three video games produced between 1997 and 1999 by ITE Media for the PC. In each of them, Hugo must rescue [[Santa Claus]] from Scylla, foiling her plots to ruin [[Christmas]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.hugo-net.com/ HugoNet] *[http://www.bukkazoom.com/ Bukkazoom]{{Dead link|date=January 2011}} *[http://www.cannoncruise.com/ Cannon Cruise]{{Dead link|date=January 2011}} *[http://www.runamukka.com/ Runamukka]{{Dead link|date=January 2011}} *[http://www.smakkaball.com/ Smakkaball]{{Dead link|date=January 2011}} *{{de icon}} [http://www.hugoswelt.de/infos/history/games/index.html The list of all games released in Germany] *{{de icon}} [http://www.hugoswelt.de/games/gamefinder/index.html Game finder by platform] {{DEFAULTSORT:Hugo (Series)}} [[Category:1997 video games]] [[Category:1998 video games]] [[Category:1999 video games]] [[Category:2000 video games]] [[Category:2002 video games]] [[Category:2003 video games]] [[Category:2004 video games]] [[Category:Game Boy games]] [[Category:Game Boy Color games]] [[Category:DOS games]] [[Category:Platform games]] [[Category:PlayStation games]] [[Category:Video games based on television series]] [[Category:Video games developed in Denmark]] [[Category:Video game franchises]] [[de:Hugo (Computerspiel)]]
